title: Making some sense of the new ESPN/MLB.TV streaming partnership and what it means to fans
author: Chad Finn
bullets: ESPN and MLB.TV announced a partnership making ESPN its new streaming home, with packages available via ESPN Unlimited.
MLB.TV access via ESPN Unlimited costs $134.99 for subscribers; non-subscribers pay $149.99, including a free month of ESPN Unlimited.
Existing MLB.TV subscribers are auto-renewed; new subscribers must register through ESPN, with optional ESPN Unlimited free trial.

title: ‘We’re real excited’: Celtics’ Ron Harper Jr. shares Jayson Tatum looked like himself in recent G League practice
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Jayson Tatum participated in a recent practice with the Maine Celtics, fueling speculation of his return this season.
Ron Harper Jr. reported Tatum looked like himself in practice but wouldn't confirm if he'll return to the Celtics this season.
Celtics maintain Tatum's status as out for each game, with no timetable for his return following Achilles tear rehab.

title: Here’s where Mass. finished on the latest list of most educated states
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Massachusetts ranked as the most educated state in the U.S. according to WalletHub's 2026 study.
Over 47% of Massachusetts adults hold a bachelor's degree, with nearly 22% having advanced degrees, both highest nationally.
Vermont and Maryland took second and third places; Louisiana, Mississippi, and West Virginia were at the bottom.

title: One of the rarest baseball cards is up for auction — and there are local connections
author: Lauren Daley
bullets: The Honus Wagner T206 baseball card, one of the rarest, is up for auction and bids close on February 21.
Ken Goldin's auction features a card from a Massachusetts-connected family, marking its first public sale after 116 years.
The current bid for the Wagner card is $3.9 million, equaling $4.758 million with a 22% buyer's premium included.

title: Bruins G Jeremy Swayman set to make Olympic debut and start for Team USA vs. Denmark
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Jeremy Swayman will make his Olympic debut as the starting goalie for Team USA against Denmark on Saturday.
Swayman, 27, helped Team USA win the IIHF World Championship in 2025 with a 5-0 record and a championship shutout.
Bruins' Charlie McAvoy will also play for Team USA, paired with Quinn Hughes on defense against Denmark.

title: New England Aquarium IDs right whale found dead off Virginia
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: A 3-year-old North Atlantic right whale was found dead off Virginia, the second such death reported in two weeks.
Identified as the 2023 calf of right whale Porcia, the whale's death is significant for the critically endangered species.
The New England Aquarium says entanglements and vessel strikes are leading causes of whale deaths; only about 380 remain.

title: Another child has died of the flu in Mass.
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Seven pediatric flu deaths have been reported in Massachusetts this season, per the Massachusetts Department of Public Health.
A total of 260 flu-related deaths, including seven children, occurred in Massachusetts this season.
Public health officials emphasize vaccination as flu cases begin to decline but continue circulating in February.

title: Mass. police department offers ‘Valentine’s Day Special’ for wanted exes
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Uxbridge Police Department encourages turning in exes with outstanding warrants via a Valentine-themed Facebook post.
Flyer suggests giving ex-partners a 'ride with flashing lights' for Valentine's Day, generating community amusement.
Similar Valentine-themed warrant initiatives have appeared in New Hampshire, Ohio, Nebraska, and New York.

title: ‘We’ll see how it plays out’: Caleb Durbin, Marcelo Mayer each to practice at 2B, 3B to begin spring training
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Caleb Durbin and Marcelo Mayer will practice at both second and third base during Red Sox spring training.
Manager Alex Cora looks to solidify Boston's starting infield soon, focusing on reducing errors from previous seasons.
The Red Sox explore versatile infield options with players like Romy Gonzalez and Isiah Kiner-Falefa added to the mix.

title: Report: Patriots QBs coach Ashton Grant to stay in New England, won’t take OC interviews
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Patriots QBs coach Ashton Grant will remain in New England, not interviewing for NFL offensive coordinator roles.
Grant played a key role in Patriots QB Drake Maye's successful second season leading to a Super Bowl appearance.
Grant, from Manchester, Conn., coached at Holy Cross and was with the Browns before joining the Patriots in 2025.
